question:
Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding attaching a file in an email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: You can remove or change attachments before sending the email.
option_2: Attachments can be previewed within the email composition window.
option_3: The size of the attachment is unlimited.
option_4: Multiple files can be attached in an email message.
solution:
• Most email services like Gmail, Outlook, etc., limit the size of attachments , usually to around 25 MB .
  • Therefore, the statement saying attachment size is "unlimited" is false .

Additional Information:

  • You can attach multiple files in a single email.
  • Attachments can be removed or changed before sending.
  • Some services allow previewing files (PDFs, images, etc.) directly in the compose window.

question:
Content to be written in the "Subject" field of an email

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: A smiley or emoji to make the email more interesting
option_4: The main topic of an email message
solution:
• The 'Subject' field is used to enter the main topic of an email message .
  • It gives recipients an immediate idea of the email’s purpose before opening it.
  • A clear, concise subject increases the likelihood your email is read and acted upon.

Additional Information:

  • Some email clients won’t allow you to send without a subject.
  • Best practice is to keep it under 50 characters and avoid vague terms like “Hello” or “Update.”
  • Including keywords relevant to the message (e.g., project name, date) helps in searching and filtering.

question:
Method to handle spam emails

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Forward the email to all your contacts
option_2: Mark the email as SPAM or Junk
option_3: Unsubscribe from all mailing lists
option_4: Reply to the sender asking them to stop
solution:
• Marking the email as SPAM or Junk instructs your email client to filter similar messages in the future.
  • This action helps train automatic filters and prevents unwanted messages from reaching your inbox.
  • Forwarding spam or replying to the sender is discouraged as it may confirm your address is active and attract more spam.

Additional Information:

  • Use the Report Spam or Report Junk button in your email client for best results.
  • Unsubscribing only works for legitimate mailing lists and often has no effect on unsolicited bulk spam.
  • Avoid clicking suspicious links or downloading attachments from unknown senders to reduce risk.

question:
Symbol used between user name and server in an email address

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The @ symbol is used to separate theuser name and the email server parts of an email address.
  • It sits between the local part and the domain (e.g., user@example.com).

Additional Information:

  • The @ character is part of the ASCII set and was chosen by Ray Tomlinson in 1971 when he created email.
  • Its use in email addresses became standardized in RFC 5322.

question:
Information required to sign in to an email client

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Full name and date of birth
solution:
• To sign in to an email client, you typically need to provide your email address and password .
  • The email address identifies your unique account on the mail server.
  • The password verifies your identity and protects your account.

Additional Information:

  • Some email clients may support two-factor authentication , requiring a code from your phone or an authenticator app.
  • Advanced clients might require server settings like IMAP/POP3 and SMTP configurations.
  • You can enable OAuth sign-in with providers like Google or Microsoft for enhanced security.

question:
Field that tells recipient what message is about (Subject line in email)

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Subject field succinctlysummarises the purpose or topic of the email.
  • It appears in the message header and is visible before the email is opened.
  • A clear subject line helps recipientsprioritise and locate messages quickly.

Additional Information:

  • The To field specifies the recipient’s email address(es).
  • The Date field shows when the email was sent.
  • The Signature field typically contains the sender’s contact information and sign-off.

question:
INCORRECT statement related to sorting in Gmail

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Depending on what we use your email address for, sorting emails can also help you keep track of trends and correspondence by looking at messages sorted by specific criteria.
option_2: Sorting mail can help us remove unwanted emails from your inbox and more easily unsubscribe from mailings we don’t need.
option_3: Sorting mail cannot help us remove unwanted emails from our inboxes and more easily unsubscribe from mailings we don’t need.
option_4: We can sort emails by a variety of factors, like the topic, sender, size, or age of the message.
solution:
• Sorting mail cannot help us remove unwanted emails… is incorrect , because sorting can indeed group and filter unwanted messages.
  • Sorting by criteria like sender, subject, or size lets you quickly identify promotional or old emails for bulk actions.
  • Gmail’s Filters can automatically sort incoming mail, making it easier to unsubscribe or delete bulk messages.

Additional Information:

  • Gmail doesn’t offer a one-click “Sort” button but uses search operators (e.g.,from:, larger:, older_than :) to filter messages.
  • Using Filters and Labels , youcan automatically categorize, archive, or delete matching emails.
  • Sorting by Size or Date helps identify large or older emails to free up space and manage your inbox effectively.

question:
Correct structure of an email address

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• name@domain.com follows the standard format: local-part@domain .
  • It contains exactly one @ separating theuser name and the domain name.
  • The domain includes a dot to separate the second-level domain and top-level domain (TLD).

Additional Information:

  • The local part (before the @) can include letters, numbers, dots, hyphens, and underscores, but cannot start or end with a dot.
  • The domain part must consist of valid labels separated by dots, and underscores are not allowed in domain labels.
  • Email addresses must comply with RFC 5322 rules to ensure deliverability across mail systems.

question:
Difference between 'Reply' and 'Reply All' in emails

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: ‘Reply’ attaches any files from the original email, while ‘Reply all’ includes any attachments along with the entire original email’s content in response.
option_2: ‘Reply’ allows you to edit the original email’s content before sending the response, while ‘Reply all’ automatically includes the entire original email’s content in the response.
option_3: ‘Reply’ forwards email to specific contacts, while ‘Reply all’ forwards the original email to all contacts in the address book.
option_4: ‘Reply’ sends the response only to the original sender, while ‘Reply all’ sends the response to all recipients of the original email.
solution:
• ‘Reply’ sends your response only to the original sender , keeping other recipients out of the loop.
  • ‘Reply all’ sends your response to every recipient (To and CC) included in the original email.
  • Use ‘Reply’ for one-on-one conversations and ‘Reply all’ when everyone on the thread needs to see your answer.

Additional Information:

  • Many email clients warn you before you use ‘Reply all’ to prevent unintended wide broadcasts.
  • You can change your email settings to default to ‘Reply’ rather than ‘Reply all’ to avoid spamming.
  • ‘Reply all’ may include yourself; be sure to remove your own address if not needed.

question:
Parts of the standard structure of an email

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• An email’s Header contains metadata like To , From , Subject , and Date .
  • The Body holds the actual message content, such as text, images, and attachments.
  • Therefore, the email structure comprises both Header and Body .

Additional Information:

  • Headers may include CC , BCC , and Message-ID for routing and identification.
  • The Body can be in HTML or plain text and may embed images or hyperlinks.
